abstract_summ: The historically unprecedented slump in overall economic output due to the coronavirus crisis creates an urgency for economic policy responses.One important goal of European climate change policy — changing existing manufacturing technologies to less greenhouse gas emitting alternatives — will become even more difficult.This has direct consequences for the EU-wide trading of greenhouse gas emission allowances, which is an important building block of European climate change policy.Addressing policy objectives beyond the economic recovery should not be the focus right now.Forecasts of economic growth have been massively revised downwards and governments around the world are struggling to find the right economic policy response.
